caption.p: Chest radiography and CT image features of infected children.

tr.td: Increased and disordered bilateral bronchovascular shadows, dense hilar shadows
Multiple scattered patchy ground-glass opacities with slightly thickened vascular shadow in the centre, blurred border and “halo sign”
The lesions are well absorbed and shrank, with density reduction in the central area
Subpleural scattered striped ground-glass opacities with clear edge
Patchy mild ground-glass opacities in the upper lobe of left lung, small patchy ground-glass opacity with clear edge in the inferior lobe of right lung
Increased and disordered bilateral bronchovascular shadows, Dense hilar shadows, a suspected small patchy blurred shadow
Multiple scattered patchy ground-glass opacities in the subpleural or peripheral of both lungs
The patchy shadows are absorbed and shrank, with density reduction

fn.label: a
fn.p: Ground-glass opacity: slightly high-density shadow, like ground glass; parenchymal band: a linear opacity, usually 1–3 mm thick and >2 cm in length (up to 5 cm) that usually extends to the visceral pleura (which is often thickened and may be retracted at the site of contact).
